template: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a multi-case customer support automation workflow for a {business_type} that involves triage, automatic resolution of simple issues, escalation of complex cases, and performance tracking; output only the prompt text under 40 words.
filled_prompt: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a multi-case customer support automation workflow for a managed hosting provider that involves triage, automatic resolution of simple issues, escalation of complex cases, and performance tracking; output only the prompt text under 40 words.

message.content: Design a workflow that sorts incoming support tickets, automatically fixes common problems, routes tricky ones to humans, and tracks response times and resolutions.
message.reasoning_content:
Hmm, the user wants a concise single-sentence prompt under 40 words for a customer support automation workflow. Let me break down the requirements: it needs to cover triage, automatic resolution of simple issues, escalation of complex cases, and performance tracking.

Okay, starting with "Design a workflow" to set the action. Then "that sorts incoming support tickets" handles the triage part. For automation, "automatically fixes common problems" covers simple issues. Escalation can be phrased as "routes tricky ones to humans." Finally, adding "while tracking response times and resolutions" captures performance tracking. 

Checking the word count: that’s exactly 21 words. The sentence flows naturally and includes all the key elements. It’s plain English and stays under the limit.
